result.execSummary:
The defendant Sadrian C. Webb was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.
  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol. Defendant subject to random UAs for compliance of sobriety.

Complete Cognitive Thinking program. Complete any assessment, treatment, and counseling deemed necessary by agent, which should include a Mental Health assessment to address trauma and grief issues. Complete AODA assessment with follow up, unless already completed and provide proof to agent.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been electronically sent to the probation office.

timeConds.notes: With huber for for work, work search, treatment, and childcare if defendant qualifies.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sadrian C. Webb

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Kimberly
Case called: 1:30pm
INCLUDES 14CF1076 & 15CF265
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Defendant appears in person with Atty Kat Jackan.

All parties have received DOC PSI & alternative PSI reports
Atty Jackan would like to make some corrections to DOC PSI report
W.W. makes statement to court
State makes argument on sentencing recommendation
Atty Jackan makes argument on sentencing recommendation
Defendant makes statement
COURT makes findings
COURT ORDERS: 15CF265 Ct. 1- Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g): I/S 6 years WSPS- 3 years IC, 3 ES. w/hold sentencing. 7 years probation. CONDITION for this Ct. ONLY: 1 year conditional jail. May be with huber release for work, work search, treatment, or child care if meets jail critiera. Deft has 45 days to report to jail. Probation is concurrent to 15CF265 Ct. 4 & 14CF1076 Ct. 1
COURT ORDERS: 15CF265 Ct. 4- Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g): w/hold sentencing. 7 years probation. 14CF1076 Ct. 1- Possess w/intent- heroin (>3-10g): w/hold sentencing. 7 years probation. Probation is concurrent to 15CF265 Ct. 1, 14CF1076 Ct. 1, and 15CF265 Ct. 4. CONDITIONS for all three cases: Complete cognitive thinking program. Complete any assessment, treatment, or counseling deemed necessary by agent, which should include a mental health assessment to address trauma and grief issues. Complete AODA assessment with follow through, unless deft already completed and provide proof to agent this was completed and comply with follow through. Absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol. Deft to obtain G.E.D. Deft is subject to random UA's to ensure compliance of sobriety. Pay CC. Pay $300 of buy back money to Wausau Police Dept. Pay DNA surcharge and provide sample. 4 days credit granted towards 14CF1076 Ct. 1 if revoked. 

Parties to maintain PSI report's in confidential manner
COURT will return $2000 cash bond posted in 14CF1076 to poster if different than defendant
Adj: 2:37pm
